name: Ext
doc:
The Ext namespace (global object) encapsulates all classes, singletons, and utility methods provided by Sencha's libraries.

Most user interface Components are at a lower level of nesting in the namespace, but many common utility functions are provided as direct properties of the Ext namespace.

Also many frequently used methods from other classes are provided as shortcuts within the Ext namespace. For example Ext.getCmp aliases Ext.ComponentManager.get.

Many applications are initiated with Ext.application which is called once the DOM is ready. This ensures all scripts have been loaded, preventing dependency issues. For example:

 Ext.application({
     name: 'MyApp',

     launch: function () {
         Ext.Msg.alert(this.name, 'Ready to go!');
     }
 });

Sencha Cmd is a free tool for helping you generate and build Ext JS (and Sencha Touch) applications. See Application for more information about creating an app.

A lower-level technique that does not use the Ext.app.Application architecture is Ext.onReady.

For more information about how to use the Ext classes, see:

  • The Learning Center
  • The FAQ
  • The forums

members.name: debugConfig
members.doc:
This object is used to enable or disable debugging for classes or namespaces. The default instance looks like this:

 Ext.debugConfig = {
     hooks: {
         '*': true
     }
 };

Typically applications will set this in their "app.json" like so:

 {
     "debug": {
         "hooks": {
             // Default for all namespaces:
             '*': true,

             // Except for Ext namespace which is disabled
             'Ext': false,

             // Except for Ext.layout namespace which is enabled
             'Ext.layout': true
         }
     }
 }

Alternatively, because this property is consumed very early in the load process of the framework, this can be set in a script tag that is defined prior to loading the framework itself.

For example, to enable debugging for the Ext.layout namespace only:

 var Ext = Ext || {};
 Ext.debugConfig = {
     hooks: {
         //...
     }
 };

For any class declared, the longest matching namespace specified determines if its debugHooks will be enabled. The default setting is specified by the '*' property.

NOTE: This option only applies to debug builds. All debugging is disabled in production builds.
members.short_doc: This object is used to enable or disable debugging for classes or namespaces. ...

members.name: manifest
members.doc:
This object is initialized prior to loading the framework (Ext JS or Sencha Touch) and contains settings and other information describing the application.

For applications built using Sencha Cmd, this is produced from the "app.json" file with information extracted from all of the required packages' "package.json" files. This can be set to a string when your application is using the (microloader)[#/guide/microloader]. In this case, the string of "foo" will be requested as "foo.json" and the object in that JSON file will parsed and set as this object.

properties.name: compatibility
properties.doc: An object keyed by package name with the value being to desired compatibility level as a version number. If this is just a string, this version is assumed to apply to the framework ('ext' or 'touch'). Setting this value to less than 5 for 'ext' will enable the compatibility layer to assist in the application upgrade process. For details on the upgrade process, see the (Upgrade Guide)[#/guides/upgrade_50].

properties.name: debug
properties.doc: An object configuring the debugging characteristics of the framework. See Ext.debugConfig which is set to this value.

properties.name: packages
properties.doc: An object keyed by package name with the value being a subset of the package's "package.json" descriptor.

members.short_doc:
This object is initialized prior to loading the framework (Ext JS or Sencha

members.name: $eventNameMap
members.doc: A map of event names which contained the lower-cased verions of any mixed case event names.
members.short_doc:
A map of event names which contained the lower-cased verions of any mixed

members.name: Logger
baseCSSPrefix
members.doc:
The base prefix to use for all Ext components. To configure this property, you should use the Ext.buildSettings object before the framework is loaded:

Ext.buildSettings = {
    baseCSSPrefix : 'abc-'
};

or you can change it before any components are rendered:

Ext.baseCSSPrefix = Ext.buildSettings.baseCSSPrefix = 'abc-';

This will change what CSS classes components will use and you should then recompile the SASS changing the $prefix SASS variable to match.
members.short_doc: The base prefix to use for all Ext components. ...

members.name: emptyFn
members.doc: A reusable empty function.

members.name: emptyString
members.doc: A zero length string which will pass a truth test. Useful for passing to methods which use a truth test to reject falsy values where a string value must be cleared.
members.short_doc: A zero length string which will pass a truth test. ...

members.name: enableFx
members.doc: True if the Ext.fx.Anim Class is available.
members.short_doc: True if the Ext.fx.Anim Class is available. ...

members.name: enableGarbageCollector
members.doc: true to automatically uncache orphaned Ext.Elements periodically. If set to false, the application will be required to clean up orpaned Ext.Elements and it's listeners as to not cause memory leakage.
members.short_doc: true to automatically uncache orphaned Ext.Elements periodically. ...

members.name: enableListenerCollection
members.doc: True to automatically purge event listeners during garbageCollection.
members.short_doc: True to automatically purge event listeners during garbageCollection. ...

members.name: enumerables
members.doc: An array containing extra enumerables for old browsers

members.name: frameStartTime
members.doc: This indicate the start timestamp of current cycle. It is only reliable during dom-event-initiated cycles and Ext.draw.Animator initiated cycles.
members.short_doc: This indicate the start timestamp of current cycle. ...

members.name: functionFactoryCache
identityFn
members.doc: A reusable identity function that simply returns its first argument.

members.name: isSecure
members.doc: True if the page is running over SSL

members.name: name
members.doc:
The name of the property in the global namespace (The window in browser environments) which refers to the current instance of Ext.

This is usually "Ext", but if a sandboxed build of ExtJS is being used, this will be an alternative name.

If code is being generated for use by eval or to create a new Function, and the global instance of Ext must be referenced, this is the name that should be built into the code.
members.short_doc: The name of the property in the global namespace (The window in browser environments) which refers to the current ins...

members.name: privateFn
members.doc:
A reusable empty function for use as privates members.

 Ext.define('MyClass', {
     nothing: Ext.emptyFn,

     privates: {
         privateNothing: Ext.privateFn
     }
 });
members.short_doc: A reusable empty function for use as privates members. ...

members.name: splitAndUnescape
validIdRe
members.doc: Regular expression used for validating identifiers.
members.short_doc: Regular expression used for validating identifiers. ...

members.name: apply
members.doc:
Copies all the properties of config to the specified object. There are two levels of defaulting supported:

 Ext.apply(obj, { a: 1 }, { a: 2 });
 //obj.a === 1

 Ext.apply(obj, {  }, { a: 2 });
 //obj.a === 2

Note that if recursive merging and cloning without referencing the original objects or arrays is needed, use Ext.Object.merge instead.

params.name: defaults
params.doc: An object that will also be applied for default values.

members.short_doc: Copies all the properties of config to the specified object. ...

members.name: applyIf
members.doc: Copies all the properties of config to object if they don't already exist.
members.short_doc: Copies all the properties of config to object if they don't already exist. ...

members.name: batchLayouts
members.doc: Utility wrapper that suspends layouts of all components for the duration of a given function.

params.name: scope
params.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the specified function is executed.

members.short_doc:
Utility wrapper that suspends layouts of all components for the duration of a given
function. ...

members.name: clone
members.doc: Clone simple variables including array, {}-like objects, DOM nodes and Date without keeping the old reference. A reference for the object itself is returned if it's not a direct decendant of Object. For model cloning, see Model.copy.
members.short_doc: Clone simple variables including array, {}-like objects, DOM nodes and Date without keeping the old reference. ...

members.name: destroy
members.doc:
Destroys all of the given objects. If arrays are passed, the elements of these are destroyed recusrively.

What it means to "destroy" an object depends on the type of object.

  • Array: Each element of the array is destroyed recursively.
  • Object: Any object with a destroy method will have that method called.
members.short_doc: Destroys all of the given objects. ...

members.name: destroyMembers
members.doc: Destroys the specified named members of the given object using Ext.destroy. These properties will be set to null.

params.name: object
params.doc: The object who's properties you wish to destroy.

params.name: args
params.doc: One or more names of the properties to destroy and remove from the object.

members.short_doc: Destroys the specified named members of the given object using Ext.destroy. ...

members.name: getUniqueGlobalNamespace
members.doc: Generate a unique reference of Ext in the global scope, useful for sandboxing
members.short_doc: Generate a unique reference of Ext in the global scope, useful for sandboxing ...

members.name: id
members.doc: Generates unique ids. If the object/element is passes and it already has an id, it is unchanged.

params.name: o
params.doc: The object to generate an id for.

members.short_doc: Generates unique ids. ...

members.name: isArray
members.doc: Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript Array, false otherwise.
members.short_doc: Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript Array, false otherwise. ...

members.name: isBoolean
members.doc: Returns true if the passed value is a boolean.
members.short_doc: Returns true if the passed value is a boolean. ...

members.name: isDate
members.doc: Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript Date object, false otherwise.
members.short_doc: Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript Date object, false otherwise. ...

members.name: isDebugEnabled
members.doc: This method returns true if debug is enabled for the specified class. This is done by checking the Ext.debugConfig.hooks config for the closest match to the given className.

return.name: return
return.doc: true if debug is enabled for the specified class.

members.short_doc: This method returns true if debug is enabled for the specified class. ...

members.name: isDefined
members.doc: Returns true if the passed value is defined.
members.short_doc: Returns true if the passed value is defined. ...

members.name: isElement
members.doc: Returns true if the passed value is an HTMLElement
members.short_doc: Returns true if the passed value is an HTMLElement ...

members.name: isEmpty
members.doc:
Returns true if the passed value is empty, false otherwise. The value is deemed to be empty if it is either:

  • null
  • undefined
  • a zero-length array
  • a zero-length string (Unless the allowEmptyString parameter is set to true)
members.short_doc: Returns true if the passed value is empty, false otherwise. ...

members.name: isFunction
members.doc: Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript Function, false otherwise.
members.short_doc: Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript Function, false otherwise. ...

members.name: isIterable
members.doc:
Returns true if the passed value is iterable, that is, if elements of it are addressable using array notation with numeric indices, false otherwise.

Arrays and function arguments objects are iterable. Also HTML collections such as NodeList and `HTMLCollection' are iterable.
members.short_doc:
Returns true if the passed value is iterable, that is, if elements of it are addressable using array
notation with nu...

members.name: isMSDate
members.doc: Returns 'true' if the passed value is a String that matches the MS Date JSON encoding format.
members.short_doc:
Returns 'true' if the passed value is a String that matches the MS Date JSON
encoding format. ...

members.name: isNumber
members.doc: Returns true if the passed value is a number. Returns false for non-finite numbers.
members.short_doc: Returns true if the passed value is a number. ...

members.name: isNumeric
members.doc: Validates that a value is numeric.
members.short_doc: Validates that a value is numeric. ...

members.name: isObject
members.doc: Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript Object, false otherwise.
members.short_doc: Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript Object, false otherwise. ...

members.name: isPrimitive
members.doc: Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript 'primitive', a string, number or boolean.
members.short_doc:
Returns true if the passed value is a JavaScript 'primitive', a string, number
or boolean. ...

members.name: makeIdSelector
members.doc: Converts an id ('foo') into an id selector ('#foo'). This method is used internally by the framework whenever an id needs to be converted into a selector and is provided as a hook for those that need to escape IDs selectors since, as of Ext 5.0, the framework no longer escapes IDs by default.
members.short_doc: Converts an id ('foo') into an id selector ('#foo'). ...

members.name: now
members.doc: Returns the current timestamp.
members.short_doc: Returns the current timestamp. ...

members.name: override
members.doc:
Overrides members of the specified target with the given values.

If the target is a class declared using Ext.define, the override method of that class is called (see Ext.Base.override) given the overrides.

If the target is a function, it is assumed to be a constructor and the contents of overrides are applied to its prototype using Ext.apply.

If the target is an instance of a class declared using Ext.define, the overrides are applied to only that instance. In this case, methods are specially processed to allow them to use Ext.Base.callParent.

 var panel = new Ext.Panel({ ... });

 Ext.override(panel, {
     initComponent: function () {
         // extra processing...

         this.callParent();
     }
 });

If the target is none of these, the overrides are applied to the target using Ext.apply.

Please refer to Ext.define and Ext.Base.override for further details.

params.name: overrides
params.doc: The properties to add or replace on target.

members.short_doc: Overrides members of the specified target with the given values. ...

members.name: resumeLayouts
members.doc:
Resumes layout activity in the whole framework.

suspendLayouts is alias of Ext.Component.suspendLayouts.

params.name: flush
params.doc: true to perform all the pending layouts. This can also be achieved by calling flushLayouts directly.

members.short_doc: Resumes layout activity in the whole framework. ...

members.name: returnId
members.doc: A reusable function which returns the value of getId() called upon a single passed parameter. Useful when creating a Ext.util.MixedCollection of objects keyed by an identifier returned from a getId method.
members.short_doc: A reusable function which returns the value of getId() called upon a single passed parameter. ...

members.name: returnTrue
members.doc: A reusable function which returns true.
members.short_doc: A reusable function which returns true. ...

members.name: setGlyphFontFamily
members.doc: Sets the default font-family to use for components that support a glyph config.
members.short_doc: Sets the default font-family to use for components that support a glyph config. ...

members.name: suspendLayouts
members.doc:
Stops layouts from happening in the whole framework.

It's useful to suspend the layout activity while updating multiple components and containers:

Ext.suspendLayouts();
// batch of updates...
Ext.resumeLayouts(true);

suspendLayouts is alias of Ext.Component.suspendLayouts.

See also batchLayouts for more abstract way of doing this.
members.short_doc: Stops layouts from happening in the whole framework. ...

members.name: valueFrom
members.doc: Returns the given value itself if it's not empty, as described in isEmpty; returns the default value (second argument) otherwise.

params.name: defaultValue
params.doc: The value to return if the original value is empty.

params.name: allowBlank
params.doc: true to allow zero length strings to qualify as non-empty.
